Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: theree is only one possible way it can break and I think I know how to fix it... but it doent seem to need fixing as its working

Author: Alright#0419
Content: how?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: if an invalid ntoarisation is made

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it could prvent a miner creating a valid block.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: invalid how?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: just eeds to count a few times how many times it tried to creat the block, if it cant then flag that tx as bad... and not include it

Author: Alright#0419
Content: how does one create an invalid notarization?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but to create it in the fiorst place... rewquires colluding notaries

Author: Alright#0419
Content: wrong pubkeys, wrong minsigs?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: very unlikely

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: no

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: wrong blockhashs

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the OP_RETURN data to be incorrect

Author: Alright#0419
Content: well

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: its so ujlikely... that I dont think a fix is needed until it happens

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it's just preventing a miner from putting a notarization in their chain that doesn't match their current chain

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so it indicates a larger problem

Author: Alright#0419
Content: you wouldn't want to continue to mine blocks on that chain anyway

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so it's a good thing that the miner would fail

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes exactly.... I dont think notaries are going to collude to break there own chains

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: if it happens we can try a fix, I already know basically how to do it... but I dont want to do the fix if its never required

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it's a feature, not a bug

Content: it will slow things doen, and likely introduce more problems

Content: similar to dpowconfs for a CEX

Author: Alright#0419
Content: halts deposits because there is a larger problem

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yep

Author: Alright#0419
Content: this halts mining because there is a larger problem

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes... it gives more power to ntoaris than they had before... but they are unlikely to use this power becasuse if will only hurt them selvs

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: To clear any misconceptions, I'm squarely in favor of a vote system where stakeholders (especially outside of our little sphere) have valued input and there's not a point where it can be argued that notaries have their jobs *just* because they are "friends" of those involved.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: The one thing I am admittedly against is changing the cycle to once per year once we hit 64 nodes

Author: Alright#0419
Content: we rely on actively involved notaries

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: we dont need to do that... its just some random thing I said in pages and pages of text

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: every 2 months, notaries who preform super badly will be removed by vote of other ntoaries

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I dont think this should ever change

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: as long as teh rules for the vote to be called are clearly defined

Author: blackjok3r#3181

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: I'm not particularly married to any idea of how long, but I am married to the idea that we need as decentralized a "hiring practice" as feasibly possible and (as discussed earlier) that utility producing NNs cannot ever be booted for merely being unpopular (the safeguard for that also aids against collusion in certain instances, I think)

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: afaik, we all agree on the latter

Content: It is 100% possibble for 99% of notaries to collude and block one notaries ip address to oust him/her ... I dont think that can be prevented

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but will it ewver happen?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: that's why I said "certain" and not "all" 😛

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: but I think that every non-hindering check we can put in place, is a long-term bonus

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: agreed.. as long as its not over compicated... simple rules must be used.

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
